body_html:
Sorry, it seems this got buried in my inbox and i missed it.

Nice job digging into this, and great job getting a working solution! It indeed, looks correct, but I am unsure why the outputs y.loss and y.backprop are backwards :( This is very strange!

For now, i think it is reasonable to proceed with your working change (with the backwards outputs) and could you create a new issue assigned to me mentioning the backwards outputs issue for this test?

Thanks a bunch!

body:
Sorry, it seems this got buried in my inbox and i missed it.

Nice job digging into this, and great job getting a working solution! It indeed, looks correct, but I am unsure why the outputs y.loss and y.backprop are backwards :( This is very strange!

For now, i think it is reasonable to proceed with your working change (with the backwards outputs) and could you create a new issue assigned to me mentioning the backwards outputs issue for this test?

Thanks a bunch!
